info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 7:40PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL WEBSTER...NORTHWESTERN CADDO...WEST CENTRAL CLAIBORNE AND BOSSIER PARISHES...SOUTHEASTERN MARION AND NORTHEASTERN HARRISON COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM CDT... At 740 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Springhill to near Gilliam to near Karnack. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Minden, Springhill, Haughton, Greenwood, Blanchard, Waskom, Jefferson, Benton, Cullen, Plain Dealing, Cotton Valley, Oil City, Sarepta, Mooringsport, Hosston, Belcher, Gilliam, and Eastwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
